descriptionProfile: 🚗 For the Love of Classics. 💵 Everything we Post is for Sale 🌃 2 brothers, NYC-based 🏁 #ClassicCarChasers
🚗 For the Love of Classics. 💵 Everything we Post is for Sale 🌃 2 brothers, NYC-based 🏁

posts.description:
CCC's Take: With plenty of room for the dog and kids, this car makes you ask yourself why bother with a mini-van?
_____________________________________________
🚘 1996 Aston Martin V8 Sportsman Estate Car
💯 One of two built for Swiss brothers; 21,000 Kilometers
📰 @BonhamsMotoring Aston Sale
📸 @BonhamsMotoring
💵 Estimate: $380,000 - $450,000
📚 This 1996 Aston Martin V8 Sportsman Estate Car may cost 10X as much as your average mini-van, but is 50X cooler. And the car offered here is one of a pair ordered from the factory by two Swiss brothers who must have also thought the same. This estate car originally left the factory as standard left-hand drive V8 in July of 1996 only to return to the factory 2 months later to be modified as a shooting brake. This car's color scheme is British Racing Green with matching upholstery and carpets to the interior, which also features plentiful walnut embellishment. In 1999 this example's engine was rebuilt by the factory and then sold to its second owner, a French art collector who loved and cared for the car until his passing. It was then sold at an auction in Paris in 2014 and has formed part of a significant private collection of Aston Martins. The car comes complete with owner's manual, service book, all tools, jack, first aid kit, battery conditioner, fitted car cover and, most importantly, a fitted humidor! Yes, you read that correctly. Drop a comment with your opinion - this one should be interesting.
_______________________________________________
#auto #instacar #carporn #autoporn #design #automotive #vintage #drive #classic #classiccar #collect #icon #classiccarchasers #carphotography #forsale #drivetastefully #aston #astonmartin #modernclassic

CCC's Take: With a top speed of 160 mph, you can go from 0 - to soccer practice in under 7 seconds 👍🏻

One of One: www.ClassicCarChasers.com 👍🏻
_____________________________________________
🚘 1948 Talbot-Lago T26 Grand Sport Carbiolet
💯 Original one-off convertible coachwork by Franay
📰 @RMSothebys Villa Erba Sale
📸 @RoadRunner333
💵 Estimate to be Announced
📚 The T26 Grand Sport, an automobile destined for the serious sportsman and chic Parisian society in equal measure. It was a grand gesture and the final flowering in France of the great tradition of the truly custom motor car. The chassis was built to carry coachwork that was the latest in grand style and luxury. The concept was outrageously exclusive and something for the very few – not just because of its price, which was stratospheric, or its limited practicality, which was irrelevant. This was a car that was chic, ritzy, aristocratic, and sharp as a knife all at once. The Grand Sport remained very rare. A maximum of 29 were built on the short wheelbase; 26 cars exist today, all with individually coachbuilt bodies.The subject car embarked upon a decade-long mechanical and cosmetic restoration to the highest concours standards, including the original Hermés interior and luggage, which has been expertly restored.  Any Talbot-Lago T26 Grand Sport is a very rare and exciting sports car. In addition, chassis 110121 is a unique one-off cabriolet of great and tasteful beauty, as evidenced by its unparalleled period history at the Paris Salons and French concours. It is a compelling and unprecedented combination 😎
_______________________________________________
#auto #instacar #carporn #autoporn #design #automotive #vintage #drive #classic #classiccar#collect #icon #classiccarchasers #carphotography #forsale #drivetastefully #coachbuilt #gentleman #luxury #speed

For Sale @CarriageHouseMotorCars: Uber Rare 6-SP 575M 👍🏻
_____________________________________________
🚘 2002 Ferrari 575M Maranello
💯 One of 246 575Ms delivered with a 6-Speed
📰 @CarriageHouseMotorCars
📸 @CarriageHouseMotorCars
💵 Price on Request
📚 Ferrari’s most famous road cars have always been those with a front-mounted V-12 and rear-wheel drive. From the company’s earliest creations to the conclusion of production of the 365 GTB/4 Daytona in 1973, they were renowned for their reputation of creating the world’s finest grand touring sports coupes. These cars were equally comfortable being put through their paces on a race track as they were crossing continents at high speed with a trunk full of luggage. Although the vast majority of buyers opted to outfit their 575M Maranello with the F1-style transmission, a handful of enthusiasts could not resist the siren call of a traditional six-speed gated manual transmission. Such is the case with the 575M Maranello offered here. Featured in Rossa Corsa over Tan leather interior, this 575M Maranello is in top collector car quality. This car has only driven a pampered 6,832 miles with its 5.7L front engine V12. With a total of 2,056 575M Maranellos produced, only 246 of them were equipped with a manual 6-speed transmission. Of the 246 produced with a manual, as few as 84 were thought to be imported in the the US. The interior is completely original and in like new condition. All of the switches and gauges are in proper working order and show no signs of age. This blue chip investment car is the essence of a traditional Ferrari and quickly gaining collectability 😎
_______________________________________________
#auto #instacar #carporn #autoporn #design #automotive #vintage #drive #classic #classiccar#collect #icon #classiccarchasers #carphotography #forsale #drivetastefully #ferrari #575m #maranello #6speed #manual #gatedshifter #italian #rare #fast #luxury #gentleman

To Restore 👍🏻 or Not to Restore 👎🏻?
_____________________________________________
🚘 1957 Aston Martin DB2/4 MkII
💯 Off the road for approximately 40 years
📰 @BonhamsMotoring Aston Martin Sale
📸 @SimonClayCarSnapper
💵 Estimate available on our website
📚 The need to widen the appeal of the already-successful DB2 resulted in the launch in October 1953 of the 2+2 DB2/4. Extensive revisions to the car's rear end arrangements made room for two occasional seats and more luggage. In addition, a raised roofline, one-piece windscreen, larger bumpers and other detail styling changes differentiated the newcomer from its predecessor. The DB2/4 MkII offered was first owned by that well-known Aston Martin enthusiast, The Hon John Dawnay of Wykeham Abbey, Scarborough. The accompanying copy order form shows that the car was delivered with the VB6L cylinder head used for the 'special series' engines, which incorporated larger valves and higher lift camshafts, and were claimed to produce 165bhp. Reregistered as '956 BPY', the Aston subsequently passed via Lamb's Garage of Finchley to Mr Andrew Ho, and then was registered to Freddie Mills' Nightspot, 143 Charing Cross Road, London WC2. One of Britain's foremost sporting heroes of the post-war era. Circa 1965, '956 BPY' passed via a motor dealer in Uxbridge to Mr M J B Scarfe of Northumberland and later Gateshead. The current vendor purchased the Aston via marque specialist R S Williams in 1970. Later in the 1970s the car was laid up following issues with the engine (which was dismantled) and has been off the road ever since. Offered for restoration and sold strictly as viewed. Who’s got a lot of free time on their hands? 😎
_______________________________________________
